member.summary: Adds a secondary identifier code to the test data for a given part. AddBarCodeLabel is the most common one. This is used to link something like a 1D code to a 2D code or some other type of identifier. AddAssembly is often used in a case where a daughter card is added to a motherboard. LaseBarcode is similar to AddBarcodeLabel, but is specifically for a case when a 2D code is lased onto a part that already has an identifier.

Default: AddBarcodeLabel

member.name: M:Gentex.Tester.UnitTestHistoryResponse.HasUnitTestPassedByOperation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns data about whether or not the given part passed at a given operation. This method doesn't care about part number. In this case, it will either return a pass, or it will return a message indicating that no record was found, or it will return a message that a record was found, but the test history indicates that it was a fail. If the part number parameter is passed in, it will also validate that the test record was tested under the matching part number and return an error if this is not the case.
member.param: Operation ID(e.g. "300") to look for records from.
The part number to compare records against. If no value is passed in here, it will ignore the part number verification.
